intro: Asplundia euryspatha, commonly known as the narrow-leaved arrowroot, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Araceae, which includes plants characterized by their spadix and spathe inflorescence. The plant features arrowhead-shaped leaves and produces clusters of small, inconspicuous flowers. Its rhizomes are often harvested for their starchy roots, which are used in traditional cuisines. Asplundia euryspatha thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in humid tropical forests.
